dmca.title: UNAUTHORIZED USE OF TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX PROPERTIES
dmca.body:
Subject: re: UNAUTHORIZED USE OF TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX PROPERTIES 
OUR REF . : HTTP://www.leela.com.ar
----


Dear Sir or Madam:
This letter is being written to you on behalf of our client, Twentieth
Century Fox Film Corporation (hereinafter "Fox").  Fox is the
exclusive
owner of all rights to the world-famous "Futurama" television series
and
related copyrights, trademarks, and indicia of origin (hereinafter
collectively referred to as the "Futurama Copyrights and Trademarks").
 No
one is authorized to copy, reproduce, distribute, or otherwise use the
Futurama Copyrights and Trademarks without the express written
permission of
Fox.

It has come to our attention that a web site located at
"http://www.leela.com.ar", for which you are the service provider,
contains
video clips, wallpaper, stamps, image galleries, screensavers, banner
ads
and episodes, as well as unauthorized derivative works of the Futurama
Copyrights and Trademarks.  Attached hereto as Exhibit 1 are
representative
pages from the aforementioned web site.  
Fox diligently enforces its rights in the Futurama Copyrights and
Trademarks
in all forms of media.  The "Futurama" television program entertains
millions of people and our client rightfully takes its responsibility
for
the protection of the Futurama Copyrights and Trademarks very
seriously.  To
this end, Fox delivered a demand letter to the operator regarding the
above-referenced web site, a copy of which is attached Exhibit 2 (
Spanish
and English version). Said letter was returned to our offices
indicating
that the owner of this web site has apparently moved to another
address.
On behalf of Fox, we request your assistance in the removal of
infringements
of the Futurama Copyrights and Trademarks from this web site and any
other
sites for which you act as an Internet service provider.  Please
contact me
at your earliest convenience to discuss this matter further.
Nothing in this letter shall be construed as a waiver or
relinquishment of
any right or remedy possessed by Fox or any other affected party, all
of
which are expressly reserved.
Very truly yours,



[Private]
 of BAKER & MCKENZIE
[Private]
(1001) Buenos Aires, Argentina
e-mail: bernard.malone@bakernet.com.ar
phone: [Private]

<hr>

CERTIFIED AIRMAIL
[Private]
(1416) Buenos Aires 
ARGENTINA

Re: UNAUTHORIZED USE OF TWENTIETH CENTURY FOX PROPERTIES
OUR REF. : HTTP://www.leela.com.ar 

Dear [Private],

We are writing to you on behalf of our client, Twentieth Century Fox
Film Corporation (hereinafter "Fox").  Fox is the exclusive owner of
all copyright, trademark and other intellectual property rights in and
to the world-famous "Futurama" television series (hereinafter "The
Futurama Copyrights and Trademarks"). No one is authorized to
reproduce, transmit, copy or otherwise utilize The Futurama Copyrights
and Trademarks without the express written permission of Fox.

Fox has dedicated tremendous time and resources to the creation of
quality entertainment programming such as "Futurama", and greatly
values the comments and suggestions of fans who enjoy Fox's programs.
However, the development and distribution of Fox's programs requires a
collaboration with many different entities, including guild
organizations representing actors, directors and writers, as well as

local, national and international television stations and cable and
satellite programming services. Based in part on these relationships,
Fox has a legal responsibility, including many contractual
obligations, to prevent the unauthorized distribution of its
proprietary material.

We recently discovered that your web site (http://leela.com.ar)
contains qudio clips and episodes, as well as unauthorized derivate
works of The Futurama Copyrights and Trademarks in the form of
wallpaper, image galleries, screensavers, and banner ads. Attached
hereto are printouts from your site.

Fox tries to support its fans whenever possible. However, after
reviewing your website, we must request that you remove all episodes,
audio clips, image galleries, wallpaper and screensavers relating to
"Futurama" from your web site as soon as possible. You are hereby put
on notice that the unauthorized use of Fox's proprietary material, as
well as the reproduction, sale and/or distribution by you of such
unauthorized and/or derivate materials (including providing such items
for free on the Internet) constitutes copyright infringement and
trademark infringement, and potentially subjects you to both criminal
and civil liability.

We also request that you remove any and all links to other sites
containing infringing "Futurama" material. You are hereby put on
notice that liability for contributory copyright infringement can
emanate from your providing such links.

We also note that, in addition to image galleries, your site contains
individual "Futurama" stationary-frame images. We must inform you that
the unauthorized display and distrivution of such images constitutes a
copyright violation. While we are not asking you to delete these
images at this time, we must nonetheless request that you prominently
display the following on every page of your site exhibiting aby
"Futurama" images:

1.- Legal Notice
